original_data.question: A 50-year-old man comes to the physician because of swelling of his legs for 2 months. Three months ago, he was diagnosed with hypertension and started on a new medication. His blood pressure is 145/95 mm Hg. Physical examination shows 2+ edema in both lower extremities. Laboratory studies are within the reference ranges. This patient was most likely treated with which of the following drugs?

model_response:
The patient was most likely treated with a calcium channel blocker (amlodipine) or an angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor (losartan). Both of these drugs are effective in treating hypertension. Edema is a common side effect of both of these medications.

Spironolactone is a potassium-sparing diuretic and would be an unlikely choice for initial treatment of hypertension.

Hydrochlorothiazide is a thiazide diuretic and would be an unlikely choice for initial treatment of hypertension.

Titrate the dose of the antihypertensive medication until the blood pressure is controlled.

Also Know:

Edema is a common side effect of calcium channel blockers and ACE inhibitors.

Edema occurs more frequently in patients receiving a calcium channel blocker and a diuretic than in patients receiving either a calcium channel blocker or a diuretic alone.

Edema occurs less frequently in patients receiving an ACE inhibitor and a diuretic than in patients receiving either an ACE inhibitor or a diuretic alone.

Reference: Satyanarayana- Biochemistry, 3rd edition, pg-139

###COMMENT: OPTION D IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Human males as cultural, psychological, sociological, political, and economic entities.
Having a black or dark core or plug.
Abnormal fluid accumulation in TISSUES or body cavities. Most cases of edema are present under the SKIN in SUBCUTANEOUS TISSUE.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.

The determination of the nature of a disease or condition, or the distinguishing of one disease or condition from another. Assessment may be made through physical examination, laboratory tests, or the likes. Computerized programs may be used to enhance the decision-making process.

Persistently high systemic arterial BLOOD PRESSURE. Based on multiple readings (BLOOD PRESSURE DETERMINATION), hypertension is currently defined as when SYSTOLIC PRESSURE is consistently greater than 140 mm Hg or when DIASTOLIC PRESSURE is consistently 90 mm Hg or more.
Drugs intended for human or veterinary use, presented in their finished dosage form. Included here are materials used in the preparation and/or formulation of the finished dosage form.
PRESSURE of the BLOOD on the ARTERIES and other BLOOD VESSELS.

The region of the lower limb in animals, extending from the gluteal region to the FOOT, and including the BUTTOCKS; HIP; and LEG.
The range or frequency distribution of a measurement in a population (of organisms, organs or things) that has not been selected for the presence of disease or abnormality.
